subject: Politics
title: The Chinese Revolution
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Chinese Revolution.

hook.text: Mao said power grows from the barrel of a gun. His revolution killed millions and remade the world's largest nation.

buildup.text: China's civil war lasted decades. Mao's communists defeated the nationalists and proclaimed the Republic in 1949.

discovery.text: The Great Leap Forward tried to industrialize overnight. It caused a famine that killed over 30 million people.

twist.text: The Cultural Revolution attacked intellectuals and tradition. Students destroyed temples, books, and lives.

climax.text: After Mao's death, Deng Xiaoping embraced markets. China became the world's factory and second largest economy.

punchline.text: China's revolution destroyed millions. Its reforms lifted millions more.

quiz.question: What was the Great Leap Forward?
options: Mao's rapid industrialization campaign that caused a famine killing over 30 million
A successful economic reform that doubled China's GDP
